## We believe two languages can be killed with one stone!
***
***

Indexing and slicing are the most operations on data frame. We compare the different ways we use between R and Python.

####
In R
```{r}
#first 2 rows
iris[1:2,]
#first 2 columns and first 10 rows
iris[1:10,1:2]
#all rows except the first 140
iris[-(1:140), ]
```
####In Python
```{python}
from sklearn.datasets import load_iris
import pandas as pd
iris_all = load_iris()
iris = iris_all.data
iris_df = pd.DataFrame(iris, columns=['Sepal_Length', 'Sepal_Width', 'Petal_Length', 'Petal_Width'])
#first 2 rows
print iris_df.iloc[[0,1],]
#first 2 columns and first 10 rows
print iris_df.iloc[xrange(10), xrange(2)]
#all rows except the first 140
print iris_df.iloc[xrange(140, 150), :]
```
